title: How cant convert ImageSource to FileImageSource

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
What you are doing is not correct - `ImageSource.FromStream` will return a `StreamImageSource`.

I would suggest making use of the conversion types provided by the NuGet packages:

 - SkiaSharp.Views
 - SkiaSharp.Views.Forms

For Xamarin.Forms, you should just be able to cast it and it will automatically convert the bitmap into an image source (https://developer.xamarin.com/api/type/SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.SKBitmapImageSource):

    buttonA.Image = (SKBitmapImageSource)pieceBitmap;

In addition to this, you can easily convert from a bitmap into an image:

    SKImage image = SKImage.FromBitmap(pieceBitmap);

Also, you can just encode a bitmap:

    SKPixmap pixmap = pieceBitmap.PeekPixels();
    SKData data = pixmap.Encode(SKEncodedImageFormat.Png, 100);

There are several image source types that may interest you:
 - `SKBitmapImageSource`
 - `SKImageImageSource`
 - `SKPictureImageSource`
 - `SKPixmapImageSource`

comments.author: skima
mattleibow
comments.body:
It appears that the `<Button>` element does not support the base `ImageSource` type for some reason:
https://developer.xamarin.com/api/property/Xamarin.Forms.Button.Image/

The `<Image>` element is fine at least.

This is a known issue with buttons and tabs and we will just have to wait. What can be done in the meantime is to just save the image to a temporary location and then pass the path to the button. This is not the most optimal, but it is what we have at this time.
